text: Location of Kežmarok District in the Prešov region Toporec (, ) is a village and municipality in Kežmarok District in the Prešov Region of north Slovakia. ==History== In historical records the village was first mentioned in 1277. From 896AD - 1920, it was a part of the Kingdom of Hungary. It is an mid-evil Slovakian village. In 1945 it's German population was expelled. The population of Toporec mostly attributes to slovak people, many high class Slovakian Gypsy's also reside in this village, the village is filled with beautiful green grassland and large properties the owners have earned by hard work and effort. The village also offers a small variety of shops, for your basic needs, closest town is about 10 km away,Kezmarok. ==Geography== The municipality lies at an altitude of 572 metres and covers an area of 28.122 km2 . It has a population of about 1690 people. ==External links== *http://www.statistics.sk/mosmis/eng/run.html Category:Villages and municipalities in Kežmarok District
title: Toporec
